These include GDPR, CCPA, LGPD, PIPA, APPI and Australia’s Privacy Act 1988. U\u003c/span\u003enderstanding what these regulations are for, how far they go (or do not go) and who they apply to is an often overlooked first step in true AI adoption.\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch2\u003eMuch Ado About Something\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cp\u003eLegislation is spurring companies to be more thoughtful about AI and how it impacts end users. Companies bear the responsibility of ensuring data is in safe hands as with any other application, and users must retain control over what data is fed to AI – in case they want to delete it.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eMany companies put a user interface on AI and expect that \u003cem\u003evoila\u003c/em\u003e – Series A funding is right around the corner. But for a lot of these startups, the entire back end of the product is open source, and the AI is training on that data.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWith AI legislation in mind, organizations must retain complete control over data. In some cases, that means making sure that AI is plug-and-play instead of one-size-fits-all. Consider the following:\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eData is a one-way street\u003c/strong\u003e. AI must function as an enterprise, closed-end model.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAI varies by function\u003c/strong\u003e. Evaluate AI investments based on who you are—customer support, software development or marketing, for example. The criticality or sensitivity of the data you share with that AI should reflect the security measures it has in place.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAI must have transparency.\u003c/strong\u003e Document everything and ensure people understand how AI is used within a product. Don’t give out intellectual property but explain how data moves from input to output. Here’s an example of how Forcepoint does this with \u003ca href=\"http://www.forcepoint.com/ai-mesh\"\u003eAI Mesh\u003c/a\u003e.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eKeep The ‘Off Switch’ in Sight\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cp\u003eMost importantly, companies must become increasingly thoughtful about how AI is integrated into the service stack. This is because on an individual basis, organizations must allow users the ability to request AI be turned off.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eConsider this: if you’ve spent the last year building a brand-new AI chatbot and a piece of legislation provides for users to opt out of it, how will you handle this request? There must be consideration to the workflows in place and how regulations can impact them.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAs an example, Forcepoint informs users, both at the prompt window and during the generated output, that they are engaging with AI and before using AI chatbot capabilities provided by Forcepoint.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eForcepoint also provides a listing of our data sub-processors that we use in support of our products and operations. Please be aware this chatbot uses Generative Artificial Intelligence to process and respond to questions. Chatbot responses may contain errors, please verify accuracy of the output.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cp\u003eThis binary usage of AI will become the standard in 2025 and beyond as enterprises continue to grapple with how to provide AI-powered software services while still providing the option for users to opt out of the AI portion of those services.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eBesides opt-out, organizations must also have the ability to identify the specific individuals interacting with AI and the personal data they share within it. \u003ca href=\"https://www.forcepoint.com/product/data-security-posture-management-dspm\"\u003eData Security Posture Management\u003c/a\u003e (DSPM) helps here by identifying and classifying the data you have so you can monitor interactions with platforms like ChatGPT Enterprise to ensure end-user activity doesn’t result in non-compliance.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eUsers are eager to take advantage of AI and companies are right to be skating toward the puck of innovation. Framework\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIndia’s\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003ca AI\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSouth Korea’s\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.msit.go.kr/bbs/view.do?sCode=eng\u0026amp;nttSeqNo=9\u0026amp;bbsSeqNo=46\u0026amp;mId=10\u0026amp;mPid=9\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAI National Strategy\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eUnited Arab Emirates’\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.digitaldubai.ae/initiatives/ai-ethics\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAI Ethics Guidelines\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp style=\"line-height:normal;\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSome of these frameworks arrived alongside \u003cstrong\u003eglobal AI laws\u003c/strong\u003e designed to push things forward at a national level:\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://artificialintelligenceact.eu/\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eEU AI Act\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e: Focuses on risk-based regulation of AI systems, categorizing them into unacceptable, high and low or minimal risk.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/presidential-actions/2023/10/30/executive-order-on-the-safe-secure-and-trustworthy-development-and-use-of-artificial-intelligence/\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eUS Executive Order on AI\u003c/strong\u003e:\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Emphasizes transparency, safety and privacy in AI development and deployment, and calls for new standards and best practices across various sectors.\u003c/span\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eNumerous U.S. states have pending legislation or enacted their own state-level AI laws.\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.tbs-sct.canada.ca/pol/doc-eng.aspx?id=32592\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCanada’s Directive on Automated Decision-Making\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003eEnsures that automated decision systems are used in a manner that is transparent, accountable and consistent with human rights. Requires impact assessments and ongoing monitoring.\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cu\u003e\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp style=\"line-height:normal;\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMany of these policies build on data protection and privacy laws already in place—some of which already account for how AI interacts with data. These include GDPR, CCPA, LGPD, PIPA, APPI and Australia’s Privacy Act 1988. U\u003c/span\u003enderstanding what these regulations are for, how far they go (or do not go) and who they apply to is an often overlooked first step in true AI adoption.\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch2\u003eMuch Ado About Something\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cp\u003eLegislation is spurring companies to be more thoughtful about AI and how it impacts end users. Companies bear the responsibility of ensuring data is in safe hands as with any other application, and users must retain control over what data is fed to AI – in case they want to delete it.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eMany companies put a user interface on AI and expect that \u003cem\u003evoila\u003c/em\u003e – Series A funding is right around the corner. But for a lot of these startups, the entire back end of the product is open source, and the AI is training on that data.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWith AI legislation in mind, organizations must retain complete control over data. In some cases, that means making sure that AI is plug-and-play instead of one-size-fits-all. Consider the following:\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eData is a one-way street\u003c/strong\u003e. AI must function as an enterprise, closed-end model.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAI varies by function\u003c/strong\u003e. Evaluate AI investments based on who you are—customer support, software development or marketing, for example. The criticality or sensitivity of the data you share with that AI should reflect the security measures it has in place.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAI must have transparency.\u003c/strong\u003e Document everything and ensure people understand how AI is used within a product. Don’t give out intellectual property but explain how data moves from input to output. Here’s an example of how Forcepoint does this with \u003ca href=\"http://www.forcepoint.com/ai-mesh\"\u003eAI Mesh\u003c/a\u003e.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eKeep The ‘Off Switch’ in Sight\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cp\u003eMost importantly, companies must become increasingly thoughtful about how AI is integrated into the service stack. This is because on an individual basis, organizations must allow users the ability to request AI be turned off.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eConsider this: if you’ve spent the last year building a brand-new AI chatbot and a piece of legislation provides for users to opt out of it, how will you handle this request? There must be consideration to the workflows in place and how regulations can impact them.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAs an example, Forcepoint informs users, both at the prompt window and during the generated output, that they are engaging with AI and before using AI chatbot capabilities provided by Forcepoint.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eForcepoint also provides a listing of our data sub-processors that we use in support of our products and operations. That’s why our AI tools and services are denoted with (*), via our \u003ca href=\"https://www.forcepoint.com/sites/default/files/2024-09/datasheet-forcepoint-sub-processors-list-Sep24-en.pdf\"\u003eForcepoint Sub-processor List\u003c/a\u003e on our website.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp class=\"text-align-center\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://live-forcepoint-drupal.pantheonsite.io/sites/default/files/2024-10/impact-of-legislation-on-ai.jpg\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp class=\"text-align-center\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-family:\u0026quot;Aptos\u0026quot;,sans-serif;font-size:11.0pt;line-height:107%;\"\u003eBy chatting, you consent to the processing of your data and the chat being stored according to Forcepoint's\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.forcepoint.com/company/privacy-policy\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-family:\u0026quot;Aptos\u0026quot;,sans-serif;font-size:11.0pt;line-height:107%;\"\u003ePrivacy Policy\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-family:\u0026quot;Aptos\u0026quot;,sans-serif;font-size:11.0pt;line-height:107%;\"\u003e. Please be aware this chatbot uses Generative Artificial Intelligence to process and respond to questions. Chatbot responses may contain errors, please verify accuracy of the output.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cp\u003eThis binary usage of AI will become the standard in 2025 and beyond as enterprises continue to grapple with how to provide AI-powered software services while still providing the option for users to opt out of the AI portion of those services.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eBesides opt-out, organizations must also have the ability to identify the specific individuals interacting with AI and the personal data they share within it. \u003ca href=\"https://www.forcepoint.com/product/data-security-posture-management-dspm\"\u003eData Security Posture Management\u003c/a\u003e (DSPM) helps here by identifying and classifying the data you have so you can monitor interactions with platforms like ChatGPT Enterprise to ensure end-user activity doesn’t result in non-compliance.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eUsers are eager to take advantage of AI and companies are right to be skating toward the puck of innovation. However, software vendors must account for legislation in the design of their services sooner rather than later.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","format":"full_html"},"pgBackgroundImage":null,"paragraphClasses":null,"paragraphFullWidth":false}],"metatag":[{"__typename":"MetaTagValue","tag":"meta","attributes":{"content":"Learn to live Without It: The Impact of Legislation on AI - Forcepoint","name":"title"}},{"__typename":"MetaTagValue","tag":"meta","attributes":{"content":"Legislators are setting tighter standards for AI, and these regulations could have an outsized impact on many businesses. data is both a vital resource and a major vulnerability. As unstructured data grows and expands across multiple environments, it becomes more challenging to protect. Data Security Posture Management (DSPM) solutions play a key role in simplifying unstructured data security.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eGartner’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.forcepoint.com/resources/industry-analyst-reports/gartner-2024-strategic-roadmap-world-class-security-unstructured\" target=\"_blank\"\u003e2024 Strategic Roadmap for World-Class Security of Unstructured Data\u003c/a\u003e urges senior security leaders to transition toward a future state where unstructured data is effectively controlled, protected, and compliant across its lifecycle.\u0026nbsp;\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eDSPM solutions offer a practical, forward-looking approach to simplify the complex process of securing unstructured data. This allows security teams to achieve visibility, automation and proactive defense capabilities that fit today’s dynamic risk landscape. Here’s how DSPM accelerates and simplifies the path toward secure unstructured data:\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eProvides unified, comprehensive visibility across data sources\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eAchieving the future state begins with visibility. DSPM provides centralized, continuous mapping of unstructured data across all repositories, including cloud environments, on-premises, and hybrid storage. This panoramic view of where sensitive data resides helps security teams reduce sprawl, monitor data movement, and promptly identify vulnerabilities. By streamlining visibility, DSPM empowers security leaders with the insights needed to maintain a strong, manageable security posture over unstructured data.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAutomates data classification and sensitivity labeling\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eUnstructured data is harder to classify. To meet that challenge. \u003ca href=\"https://www.forcepoint.com/product/data-security-posture-management-dspm\"\u003eForcepoint DSPM’s\u003c/a\u003e use of AI-driven automation in \u003ca href=\"https://www.forcepoint.com/blog/insights/forcepoint-dspm-ai-mesh\"\u003ethe form of AI Mesh\u003c/a\u003e) enables real-time, accurate labeling based on content. This automated classification process ensures that sensitive data is consistently protected without manual intervention, while also aligning classifications to internal policies and regulatory standards. Security teams can then implement granular controls around labeled data, minimizing risks of accidental exposure or non-compliance.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eProvides contextualized, real-time risk insights\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eOne of the future state's goals is proactive, risk-based security, which DSPM achieves by delivering real-time, contextual insights. Tools like our \u003ca href=\"https://www.forcepoint.com/product/risk-adaptive-protection\"\u003eRisk-Adaptive Protection\u003c/a\u003e build on this by assigning risk scores based on user behaviors, access trends, and environmental factors, highlighting unusual access patterns or activities that deviate from the norm. This allows security leaders to prioritize responses based on risk impact, ensuring that high-priority threats are addressed swiftly.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eProvides streamlined access management and permissions monitoring\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eManaging permissions for unstructured data is challenging, especially in collaborative environments. DSPM provides granular access controls that continuously scan and monitor permissions across repositories. With this, security teams can quickly address permissions drift or risky access and ensure that only authorized users have access to sensitive files. Real-time permission insights and recommendations also reduce insider threats, ensuring that security policies adapt as the environment changes.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePaves the way for rapid detection and response capabilities\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eGiven the pace of today’s threat landscape, quick detection and response are crucial. DSPM’s real-time monitoring capabilities detect incidents as they happen, enabling security teams to respond promptly. Integrated with SIEM and SOAR tools, DSPM can trigger alerts when it detects anomalies like unauthorized file access, data exfiltration, or unusual user behaviors. This fast, automated response aligns with the future state’s emphasis on resilience, minimizing data loss and mitigating damage before incidents escalate.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eLeads to simplified compliance and governance\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eWith regulations such as GDPR and CCPA enforcing stringent data protection, DSPM is key to maintaining compliance. It automates data governance tasks, mapping sensitive data to compliance requirements and generating an auditable trail of data handling. This simplification not only saves time and reduces compliance costs but also ensures that regulatory obligations are met consistently. By aligning security practices with regulatory mandates, DSPM supports organizations in achieving a compliant and transparent security posture with less manual effort.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch2\u003eThe Road to the Future State Starts with DSPM\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cp\u003eDSPM is more than just a tool—it’s a critical asset for unstructured data security. By consolidating visibility, automation, risk-based insights, access management, rapid response, and compliance support, DSPM builds a proactive, scalable approach to protect unstructured data.\u0026nbsp;\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThis future-focused approach prepares organizations to adapt and grow within an increasingly complex data environment, enabling them to confidently meet the challenge of securing unstructured data.\u0026nbsp;\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eIf your organization needs help on the path to unstructured data security, talk to \u003ca href=\"https://www.forcepoint.com/product/data-security-posture-management-dspm\"\u003eone of our experts.\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e###\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eGartner, Inc.\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.forcepoint.com/resources/industry-analyst-reports/gartner-2024-strategic-roadmap-world-class-security-unstructured\" target=\"_blank\"\u003e2024 Strategic Roadmap for World-Class Security of Unstructured Data\u003c/a\u003e. Tools like our \u003ca href=\"https://www.forcepoint.com/product/risk-adaptive-protection\"\u003eRisk-Adaptive Protection\u003c/a\u003e build on this by assigning risk scores based on user behaviors, access trends, and environmental factors, highlighting unusual access patterns or activities that deviate from the norm. This allows security leaders to prioritize responses based on risk impact, ensuring that high-priority threats are addressed swiftly.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eProvides streamlined access management and permissions monitoring\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eManaging permissions for unstructured data is challenging, especially in collaborative environments. DSPM provides granular access controls that continuously scan and monitor permissions across repositories. With this, security teams can quickly address permissions drift or risky access and ensure that only authorized users have access to sensitive files. Real-time permission insights and recommendations also reduce insider threats, ensuring that security policies adapt as the environment changes.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePaves the way for rapid detection and response capabilities\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eGiven the pace of today’s threat landscape, quick detection and response are crucial. DSPM’s real-time monitoring capabilities detect incidents as they happen, enabling security teams to respond promptly. Integrated with SIEM and SOAR tools, DSPM can trigger alerts when it detects anomalies like unauthorized file access, data exfiltration, or unusual user behaviors. This fast, automated response aligns with the future state’s emphasis on resilience, minimizing data loss and mitigating damage before incidents escalate.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eLeads to simplified compliance and governance\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eWith regulations such as GDPR and CCPA enforcing stringent data protection, DSPM is key to maintaining compliance. It automates data governance tasks, mapping sensitive data to compliance requirements and generating an auditable trail of data handling. This simplification not only saves time and reduces compliance costs but also ensures that regulatory obligations are met consistently. By aligning security practices with regulatory mandates, DSPM supports organizations in achieving a compliant and transparent security posture with less manual effort.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch2\u003eThe Road to the Future State Starts with DSPM\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cp\u003eDSPM is more than just a tool—it’s a critical asset for unstructured data security. By consolidating visibility, automation, risk-based insights, access management, rapid response, and compliance support, DSPM builds a proactive, scalable approach to protect unstructured data.\u0026nbsp;\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThis future-focused approach prepares organizations to adapt and grow within an increasingly complex data environment, enabling them to confidently meet the challenge of securing unstructured data.\u0026nbsp;\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eIf your organization needs help on the path to unstructured data security, talk to \u003ca href=\"https://www.forcepoint.com/product/data-security-posture-management-dspm\"\u003eone of our experts.\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e###\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eGartner, Inc.\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.forcepoint.com/resources/industry-analyst-reports/gartner-2024-strategic-roadmap-world-class-security-unstructured\" target=\"_blank\"\u003e2024 Strategic Roadmap for World-Class Security of Unstructured Data\u003c/a\u003e. with using various tools and services and balance those against the organization’s specific risk tolerance. In certain high-security environments we may very well need highly restrictive access policies for unsanctioned web services, but for most organizations there is more to be gained from allowing controlled usage of various online services.\u0026nbsp;\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eIf that’s the case, then the question then becomes: what is the most effective way to implement the right amount of control to mitigate the biggest risks and enable work to flow unimpeded?\u0026nbsp;\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eTo answer that, we need to take stock of the risks with using Shadow IT, then we can identify if we have any tools in place already to help address these risks.\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch2\u003eThe Top Two Shadow IT Security Risks\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe biggest risk for modern business is data theft. Shadow IT can increase the risk of data theft because these web resources are not managed by the organization so it can be nearly impossible to control what kind of data is being stored in or downloaded from shadow IT applications, which can also lead to potential malware exposure. The costs to your business from these risks exceed the monetary fines too. AI Mesh","status":true,"title":"Exploring AI Mesh","type":"card"}},{"__typename":"ParagraphWysiwyg","id":"87372","pgFeatureBody":{"value":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNote from Lionel: \u003c/strong\u003eFuture Insights 2025 is a blog series where we asked our senior security leaders what they see as the future of the cybersecurity industry. We kick off the 2025 series with \u003ca href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/search/results/all/?heroEntityKey=urn%3Ali%3Afsd_profile%3AACoAAADNWtUBPk7UIxwbnVudIc1uADdyRKm_58w\u0026amp;keywords=Jaimen%20Hoopes\u0026amp;origin=ENTITY_SEARCH_HOME_HISTORY\u0026amp;sid=d)7\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eJaimen Hoopes\u003c/strong\u003e,\u003c/a\u003e GM of Data Security \u0026amp; VP of Product Management, on the topic of AI Security Posture Management (AISPM).\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e###\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eEffective data security requires more than simply putting measures in place to block the exfiltration of sensitive information; it also calls for gaining an accurate understanding of what and where data is in the first place and weeding out ROT (Redundant, Obsolete and Trivial) data. That’s why in addition to our celebrated \u003ca href=\"https://www.forcepoint.com/product/forcepoint-one-data-security\"\u003eData Loss Prevention\u003c/a\u003e (DLP) capabilities, Forcepoint offers a \u003ca href=\"https://www.forcepoint.com/product/data-security-posture-management-dspm\"\u003eData Security Posture Management\u003c/a\u003e (DSPM) solution. This takes a proactive approach to security by discovering, classifying and orchestrating data while employing automation to rapidly detect emerging risk factors.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eIn today's rapidly evolving technological landscape, artificial intelligence (AI) has become an integral component of many enterprise operations. From enhancing customer experiences to streamlining internal processes, AI tools are driving significant advancements across industries. However, with great power comes great responsibility, and it's crucial for businesses to understand the risks associated with AI and how to manage them effectively. This is where \u003cstrong\u003eAI Security Posture Management\u003c/strong\u003e (AISPM) comes into play.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch2\u003eThe importance of understanding AI risks\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cp\u003eAI systems, while transformative, introduce a unique set of risks that differ significantly from traditional IT threats. These risks can have profound implications for an enterprise, ranging from data breaches to operational disruptions. Understanding these risks is essential for safeguarding your business's assets, reputation and overall functionality.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eData Privacy and Security\u003c/strong\u003e: AI tools often require vast amounts of data to function effectively. This data can include sensitive information, and any breach or misuse could lead to severe privacy violations and legal consequences.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eModel Vulnerabilities\u003c/strong\u003e: AI models are not immune to attacks. Adversarial attacks, where malicious actors manipulate input data to deceive AI systems, can lead to incorrect outputs and decisions, potentially causing significant harm.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBias and Fairness\u003c/strong\u003e: AI systems can inadvertently perpetuate or amplify biases present in training data. This can result in unfair treatment of individuals or groups, leading to ethical and legal concerns.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eOperational Risks\u003c/strong\u003e: AI systems can malfunction or produce unexpected outcomes due to flaws in the model or changes in data patterns, potentially disrupting business operations.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003ch2\u003eWhat exactly is AISPM, and what do you do with it?\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cp\u003eWhereas CSPM focuses on cloud infrastructure and DSPM encompasses data in all stages of its lifecycle, AISPM focuses on the security of AI and Machine Learning (ML) systems wherever they are used in your organization.\u0026nbsp;\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAISPM is tailored to addressing the vulnerabilities associated with AI systems and how they interact with data and infrastructure. Key AISPM capabilities that you can use to solve AI security problems include:\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAI Discovery:\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003eTo gain visibility on which AI tools are being used, including shadow AI, start with a thorough assessment of the AI tools in use. Identify potential risks related to data, model integrity and operational impact. Regularly update this assessment as the technology and threat landscape evolve. Leverage tools that can help identify shadow IT AI tools that may be used by individuals or teams throughout the organization without having been fully sanctioned by your corporation.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMisconfiguration Detection\u003c/strong\u003e: Use this to identify misconfigured AI services and apply configuration rules.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eData Governance\u003c/strong\u003e: Implement robust data governance practices to ensure data used for training and operational purposes is secure, accurate and compliant with privacy regulations. This includes data encryption, access controls and regular audits.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAttack Path Remediation\u003c/strong\u003e: Identify and eliminate vulnerabilities and avoid sensitive information mixing with training data.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCompliance Enforcement\u003c/strong\u003e: Ensure that all AI use is conducted according to applicable regulatory requirements, from configuration to reporting.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eOngoing Monitoring and Improvement\u003c/strong\u003e: AI security is not a one-time task but an ongoing process. Continuously monitor AI systems for emerging threats and vulnerabilities and adapt your security measures accordingly.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eAs AISPM gains in popularity as a solution category – and I fully expect that it will continue to do so – we may see the emergence of a more detailed and standardized set of capabilities that every AISPM vendor will offer as table stakes.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch2\u003eWhat makes Forcepoint a major player for AISPM?\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cp\u003eForcepoint is well positioned to take a leading part in the AISPM conversation, with our specialization in data security that from the beginning has been heavily focused on \u003ca href=\"https://www.forcepoint.com/use-case/generative-ai-data-security\"\u003ecountering the emerging threats\u003c/a\u003e associated with generative AI. The \u003ca href=\"https://www.forcepoint.com/ai-mesh\"\u003eAI Mesh\u003c/a\u003e model that currently powers classification for our DSPM solution can radically \u003ca href=\"https://www.forcepoint.com/use-case/classify-protect-sensitive-data\"\u003eimprove the accuracy\u003c/a\u003e with which organizations identify sensitive data and guard it from exfiltration via AI systems.\u0026nbsp;\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eIn the video below, I provide an overview of what differentiates AI Mesh and makes it so transparent and efficient. At the heart of this performance is the generative AI Small Language Model (SLM), which requires far less computing power and is therefore faster and more easily customizable than an LLM.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","processed":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNote from Lionel: \u003c/strong\u003eFuture Insights 2025 is a blog series where we asked our senior security leaders what they see as the future of the cybersecurity industry. We kick off the 2025 series with \u003ca href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/search/results/all/?heroEntityKey=urn%3Ali%3Afsd_profile%3AACoAAADNWtUBPk7UIxwbnVudIc1uADdyRKm_58w\u0026amp;keywords=Jaimen%20Hoopes\u0026amp;origin=ENTITY_SEARCH_HOME_HISTORY\u0026amp;sid=d)7\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eJaimen Hoopes\u003c/strong\u003e,\u003c/a\u003e GM of Data Security \u0026amp; VP of Product Management, on the topic of AI Security Posture Management (AISPM).\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e###\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eEffective data security requires more than simply putting measures in place to block the exfiltration of sensitive information; it also calls for gaining an accurate understanding of what and where data is in the first place and weeding out ROT (Redundant, Obsolete and Trivial) data. That’s why in addition to our celebrated \u003ca href=\"https://www.forcepoint.com/product/forcepoint-one-data-security\"\u003eData Loss Prevention\u003c/a\u003e (DLP) capabilities, Forcepoint offers a \u003ca href=\"https://www.forcepoint.com/product/data-security-posture-management-dspm\"\u003eData Security Posture Management\u003c/a\u003e (DSPM) solution. However, with great power comes great responsibility, and it's crucial for businesses to understand the risks associated with AI and how to manage them effectively. transpose NIS2 into national law happens on 17 October. If you’re one of the member states of the European Union (EU), or if you are a supplier to an organization that does business in those member states, chances are your organization has already been thinking about NIS2 compliance.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eHere are three things to consider:\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch2\u003eNIS2 expands requirements, applies to more organizations\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cp\u003eNIS2 builds on a lot of the requirements that NIS1 put into motion. While NIS1 went a long way toward improving the level of security across the EU. NIS2 adds more requirements, but more importantly, NIS2 expands requirements to a broader set of companies beyond regulated industries and critical infrastructure—by some estimates, NIS2 applies to 160K more organizations than its NIS1 counterpart.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch2\u003eNIS2 expands accountability to the C-Suite and beyond\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cp\u003eNIS2 is also about expanding accountability within those organizations it applies to. With NIS2, compliance and cyber readiness is no longer just the purview of IT and security departments. It also requires senior executives and even board members to sign off on compliance requirements and even risk response when a breach occurs.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch2\u003eNIS2 shines a light on incident recovery\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cp\u003eIn today’s digital world, all companies have a vested interest in securing their businesses. But when a breach occurs, NIS2 requires organizations to have incident management procedures in place to ensure they can quickly and effectively detect, respond to and recover from cyber incidents. In this aspect, NIS2 compliance may prompt applicable organizations to review and update their existing business continuity protocols.\u0026nbsp;\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eKeeping data secure is core to what we do here at Forcepoint. lang=\"EN-GB\"\u003eIn early October, the X-Labs research team identified a malspam campaign targeting Italian businesses and individuals through PEC (Posta Elettronica Certificata). PEC is a certified email system commonly used in Italy for secure, legally recognized communication. It is widely adopted by individuals, businesses and public administrations—especially in cases where proof of communication is needed. Due to its trusted nature, PEC is often exploited by cybercriminals for malicious purposes.\u0026nbsp;\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan lang=\"EN-GB\"\u003eOur team observed multiple similar malspam emails targeting various entities through their cloud telemetry. Fig. 1 illustrates an example of an email using PEC to distribute malicious code.\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-family:\u0026quot;Times New Roman\u0026quot;,serif;font-size:16.0pt;line-height:107%;\" lang=\"EN-GB\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp class=\"text-align-center\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://live-forcepoint-drupal.pantheonsite.io/sites/default/files/2024-10/fig%201%20-%20malspam-email.png\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp class=\"text-align-center\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFig. 1 \u003c/strong\u003e- Malspam email\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan lang=\"EN-GB\"\u003eThe email was intended for an Italian customer. Let walk through key elements.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan lang=\"EN-GB\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003enew-alias press c$($qgbulzirjil)l;:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"letter-spacing:.25pt;\" lang=\"EN-GB\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eThis is creating a new alias named \u003cstrong\u003epress\u003c/strong\u003e, and it is creating it dynamically based on the variable \u003cstrong\u003e$qgbulzirjil. $qgbulzirjil\u003c/strong\u003e is defined as \u003cstrong\u003e'ur'\u003c/strong\u003e, so \u003cstrong\u003ec$($qgbulzirjil)l \u003c/strong\u003eexpands to \u003cstrong\u003e'curl',\u003c/strong\u003emaking press an alias for curl (which is used to send HTTP requests).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan lang=\"EN-GB\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e$bumtcbxgwj=(7251,7253,7270\u003c/strong\u003e...\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"letter-spacing:.25pt;\" lang=\"EN-GB\"\u003edefines a series of numbers, and the following loop iterates through them. October, the X-Labs research team identified a malspam campaign targeting Italian businesses and individuals through PEC (Posta Elettronica Certificata). PEC is a certified email system commonly used in Italy for secure, legally recognized communication. It is widely adopted by individuals, businesses and public administrations—especially in cases where proof of communication is needed. Due to its trusted nature, PEC is often exploited by cybercriminals for malicious purposes.\u0026nbsp;\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan lang=\"EN-GB\"\u003eOur team observed multiple similar malspam emails targeting various entities through their cloud telemetry. 2024, we’ve been seeing hackers increasingly rely on legitimate services to carry out attacks.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe \u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003eX-Labs team recently observed an interesting small attack pretending to be a legitimate Ukrainian bank payment confirmation. In this case, they used a Remote Manipulator System (RMS) tool to gain control of infected systems. Here's an analysis of this recent attack.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAll the emails observed in this campaign shared the same subject line, \u003cstrong\u003e“Платіжне доручення” \u003c/strong\u003e(Payment Order) and appeared to come from different senders—likely compromised email accounts.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp class=\"text-align-center\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://live-forcepoint-drupal.pantheonsite.io/sites/default/files/2024-10/Image%201-view-of-received-email.png\" p=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp class=\"text-align-center wysiwyg-body-3\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFig. 1\u003c/strong\u003e - View of received email\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThis attack targets government domains as well as well-known companies. Interestingly, while the email content is in Ukrainian, it’s likely the recipients do not speak the language—raising suspicions about the attack's intent. The body of the email is brief and identical across samples. The only variation being the sender's name in the signature part, which matches the name in the \"From\" field. These names are unusually rare, even for native Ukrainian speakers.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAttached to the email is a PDF that mimics an official letterhead from biggest Ukrainian state bank \"Privat Bank,\" requesting confirmation of a payment.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp class=\"text-align-center\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://live-forcepoint-drupal.pantheonsite.io/sites/default/files/2024-10/Image%202-pdf-attachment.png\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp class=\"text-align-center wysiwyg-body-3\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFig. 2 \u003c/strong\u003e- PDF attachment\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe document contains a link that leads to a Bitbucket site: hxxps://bitbucket[.]org/invoicepays/file/downloads/doc.7. This link initiates the download of a zipped file. When unpacked, it contains another folder and inside with another zip file.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp class=\"text-align-center\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://live-forcepoint-drupal.pantheonsite.io/sites/default/files/2024-10/image%203-content-of-dowloaded-zip-file.jpg\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp class=\"text-align-center wysiwyg-body-3\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eFig. 3\u003c/strong\u003e - Contents of downloaded ZIP file\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWithin this second Zip, there are two files: one is a folder, the other is another PDF.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp class=\"text-align-center\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://live-forcepoint-drupal.pantheonsite.io/sites/default/files/2024-10/image%204-contents-of-the-second-zip-archive.jpg\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp class=\"text-align-center wysiwyg-body-3\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFig. 4\u003c/strong\u003e - Contents of second ZIP archive\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eInside the folder we have two more files. This time, it’s a text file with a password that unlocks a password-protected RAR archive.\u0026nbsp;\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp class=\"text-align-center\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://live-forcepoint-drupal.pantheonsite.io/sites/default/files/2024-10/image%205-contents-of-second-zip-folder.jpg\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp class=\"text-align-center wysiwyg-body-3\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFig. 5\u003c/strong\u003e - Contents of second ZIP folder\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWhen unlocked using the provided password, the password-protected RAR archive opens into a folder containing two PDF files and an SCR file.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp class=\"text-align-center\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://live-forcepoint-drupal.pantheonsite.io/sites/default/files/2024-10/image%206-contents-of-password-protected-rar-archive.jpg\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp class=\"text-align-center wysiwyg-body-3\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFig. 6\u003c/strong\u003e - Contents of password-protected RAR archive\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWhile it runs quietly in the background, it’s very possible that a user only observes the PDF documents nested between directories and archives while the SCR file does its job.\u003c/p\u003e\u003ch2\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAnalysis of the SCR file:\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cp\u003eIt is an SFX self-extracting RAR installer file that contains another .msi installer in its resource section. In this case, they used a Remote Manipulator System (RMS) tool to gain control of infected systems. Here's an analysis of this recent attack.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAll the emails observed in this campaign shared the same subject line, \u003cstrong\u003e“Платіжне доручення” \u003c/strong\u003e(Payment Order) and appeared to come from different senders—likely compromised email accounts.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp class=\"text-align-center\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://live-forcepoint-drupal.pantheonsite.io/sites/default/files/2024-10/Image%201-view-of-received-email.png\" p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp class=\"text-align-center wysiwyg-body-3\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFig. 1\u003c/strong\u003e - View of received email\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThis attack targets government domains as well as well-known companies. Interestingly, while the email content is in Ukrainian, it’s likely the recipients do not speak the language—raising suspicions about the attack's intent. The body of the email is brief and identical across samples. The only variation being the sender's name in the signature part, which matches the name in the \"From\" field. These names are unusually rare, even for native Ukrainian speakers.\u003co:p\u003e\u003c/o:p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAttached to the email is a PDF that mimics an official letterhead from biggest Ukrainian state bank \"Privat Bank,\" requesting confirmation of a payment.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp class=\"text-align-center\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://live-forcepoint-drupal.pantheonsite.io/sites/default/files/2024-10/Image%202-pdf-attachment.png\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp class=\"text-align-center wysiwyg-body-3\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFig. 2 \u003c/strong\u003e- PDF attachment\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe document contains a link that leads to a Bitbucket site: hxxps://bitbucket[.]org/invoicepays/file/downloads/doc.7. Visibility: \u003c/strong\u003eTo effectively manage your IT environment, visibility is key. Forcepoint ONE CASB’s Shadow IT discovery tools empower IT departments with a comprehensive view of all cloud services and applications in use. This level of visibility is crucial for identifying and mitigating potential risks, ensuring robust security and compliance across the organization.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003carticle class=\"media media--type-image media--view-mode-full-size\"\u003e\n  \n      \n  \u003cdiv class=\"field field--name-field-media-image field--type-image field--label-visually_hidden\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv class=\"field__label visually-hidden\"\u003eImage\u003c/div\u003e\n              \u003cdiv class=\"field__item\"\u003e  \u003cimg src=\"/sites/default/files/2024-10/forcepoint-one-casb-console.jpg\" width=\"800\" height=\"414\" alt=\"Forcepoint ONE CASB console\" loading=\"lazy\"\u003e\n\n\u003c/div\u003e\n          \u003c/div\u003e\n\n  \u003c/article\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan class=\"EOP SCXW83017370 BCX8\" style=\"-webkit-tap-highlight-color:transparent;-webkit-user-drag:none;font-family:Aptos, Aptos_EmbeddedFont, Aptos_MSFontService, sans-serif;font-size:14pt;line-height:24.4125px;margin:0px;padding:0px;user-select:text;\" data-ccp-props=\"{\u0026quot;201341983\u0026quot;:0,\u0026quot;335559738\u0026quot;:240,\u0026quot;335559739\u0026quot;:240,\u0026quot;335559740\u0026quot;:279}\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eRisk Score Assessment: \u003c/strong\u003eForcepoint’s ONE CASB empowers customers to flexibly assess and manage cloud risk using the Cloud Score Widgets Wizard. This tool calculates cloud risk scores through a weighted formula that considers various app attributes alongside Forcepoint ONE SSE’s automated Trust Rating. Customers can easily adjust the weight of each attribute (from 1 to 10) on the Cloud Score Weights page, allowing them to prioritize what matters most. For instance, if GAAP compliance is given more weight, apps with GAAP compliance will score higher.
